intro: Thelymitra ixioides f. merraniae, commonly known as the Merranella form, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Australia. It features a sympodial growth habit with a short, underground rhizome and erect, linear leaves. The plant produces a single, showy spike bearing several pale yellow to greenish-white flowers with prominent yellow dorsal sepal and petals. Its botanical characteristics are closely related to the species Thelymitra ixioides, but it is distinguished by specific morphological traits. This orchid is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in heathland or open forest environments.
